data.title: Shah Rukh Khan will be back as ‘Don’, but not for Farhan Akhtar’s eponymous series!
data.meta_description: As per a Pinkvilla report, Khan is set to portray the role of a Don in an upcoming project titled 'King'. Similar to his iconic character from the 'Don' series, this role will also have nuanced shades of grey. The film will feature his daughter Suhana and will be produced by his wife Gauri and directed by Siddharth Anand, known for 'Pathaan'.
data.text:
Synopsis

As per a Pinkvilla report, Khan is set to portray the role of a Don in an upcoming project titled 'King'. Similar to his iconic character from the 'Don' series, this role will also have nuanced shades of grey. The film will feature his daughter Suhana and will be produced by his wife Gauri and directed by Siddharth Anand, known for 'Pathaan'.

Brace yourselves, because ‘Don’ is all set to return to the big screen! No, not Mark Donald - the charming and sinister protagonist of Farhan Akhtar’s hit franchise in the 2000s… Shah Rukh Khan will be back as a gangster in a different movie altogether.

According to a Pinkvilla report, Khan will step into the shoes of a Don for a project called ‘King’. Just like his iconic character from the ‘Don’ series, this role will also have some shades of grey. The movie will also star his daughter Suhana and will be produced by his wife Gauri and ‘Pathaan; director Siddharth Anand.

A source close to the ‘Jawan’ star described ‘King’ as Khan’s “passion project.”

“Shah Rukh Khan is making films for the audience and is well aware about their urge to see him in shades of grey. King is his passion project and he has been meticulously working on all aspects of the project with Siddharth Anand and Sujoy Ghosh. They have collectively carved a very cool full of attitude and swag character with shades of grey for SRK in King,” he said.

SRK To Sport A Rugged Look?

According to the report, the superstar will be seen in a long-haired look. He will also sport a faint beard.

About ‘King’

Helmed by Sujoy Ghosh (best known for ‘Kahaani’), ‘King’ will explore the journey of a mentor and disciple and their attempts to survive against all odds. The movie will mark Suhana’s big-screen debut. Previously, she essayed the role of Veronica in the Netflix drama ‘The Archies’.
